comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: Lockheed Model 14. Supplied to the RAF as the "Hudson," known within the AAF as an A-28, A-29 or AT-18.

comment.author: 41131493@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13935339@N05] Thank you very much for your information! Based on what you have given us, we were able to discover that the aircraft in the photograph is a Lockheed AT-18A-LO Hudson (L-414), serial number 42-055552. While most of the A-28 and A-29 models were split between the RAF and the USAF, based on our information, this is a model AT-18A which seems to have been used exclusively by the USAF for navigational training. Only 83 of this aircraft model were ever built.
